equitorch.math.angles_to_xyz(theta, phi, dim=-1)

Convert spherical coordinates \((\theta, \phi)\) into Cartesian coordinates \((x, y, z)\) on the unit sphere.

Uses the physics convention of spherical coordinates. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spherical_coordinate_system

Parameters:

  • theta (Tensor) – The polar angles, tensor of shape \((...)\)

  • phi (Tensor) – The azimuthal angles, tensor of shape \((...)\)

  • dim (int, optional) – The dimension along which to stack the result. Defaults to -1.

Returns:

Cartesian coordinates, tensor of \(\text{shape}[\text{dim}]=3\).

Return type:

Tensor

equitorch.math.xyz_to_angles(xyz, need_normalize, dim=-1)

Convert Cartesian coordinates \((x, y, z)\) to spherical coordinates \((\theta, \phi)\).

Follows the equation:

\[\mathbf{r} = \mathbf{R}_z(\phi) \mathbf{R}_y(\theta) \mathbf{e}_z\]

:: where \(\mathbf{R}_z\) and \(\mathbf{R}_y\) are rotation matrices, and \(\mathbf{e}_z\) is the unit vector along z-axis.

Parameters:

  • xyz (Tensor) – Cartesian coordinates, tensor of \(\text{shape}[\text{dim}]=3\).

  • need_normalize (bool) – Whether to normalize the input coordinates

  • dim (int, optional) – The dimension containing the xyz coordinates. Defaults to -1.

Returns:

  • phi : Azimuthal angle, tensor of shape \((...)\)

  • theta : Polar angle, tensor of shape \((...)\)

Return type:

Tuple[Tensor, Tensor]

equitorch.math.angles_to_matrix(alpha, beta, gamma)

Convert Z-Y-Z Euler angles to rotation matrices.

Parameters:

  • alpha (Tensor) – First rotation angle around Z-axis, tensor of shape \((...)\)

  • beta (Tensor) – Second rotation angle around Y-axis, tensor of shape \((...)\)

  • gamma (Tensor) – Third rotation angle around Z-axis, tensor of shape \((...)\)

Returns:

Rotation matrices of shape \((..., 3, 3)\)

Return type:

Tensor

equitorch.math.wigner_D(L: equitorch.typing.DegreeRange, alpha: torch.Tensor, beta: torch.Tensor, gamma: torch.Tensor)

Wigner D matrix representation of \(\text{SO(3)}\) parameterized by Z-Y-Z angles on the spaces of degree range \(L\).

It satisfies the following properties:

  • \(\mathbf{D}(\mathbf{I}) = \mathbf{I}\)

  • \(\mathbf{D}(\mathbf{R}_1 \mathbf{R}_2) = \mathbf{D}(\mathbf{R}_1)\mathbf{D}(\mathbf{R}_2)\)

  • \(\mathbf{D}(\mathbf{R}^\top) = \mathbf{D}(\mathbf{R})^\top\)

Parameters:

  • L (DegreeRange) – The degree range.

  • alpha (Tensor) – tensor of shape \((...)\) Rotation \(\alpha\) around Z axis, applied third.

  • beta (Tensor) – tensor of shape \((...)\) Rotation \(\beta\) around Y axis, applied second.

  • gamma (Tensor) – tensor of shape \((...)\) Rotation \(\gamma\) around Z axis, applied first.

Returns:

tensor \(D^l(\alpha, \beta, \gamma)\) of shape \((...,\text{num_orders}, \text{num_orders})\)

Return type:

Tensor

Warning

This function is currently not optimized. Thus it is not recommended to use it in iterations.

equitorch.math.spherical_harmonics(X: torch.Tensor, L: equitorch.typing.DegreeRange, need_normalize: bool = False, dim: int = -1)

Compute spherical harmonics for given Cartesian coordinates.

Gives the spherical harmonics of exactly the same shape as in here in the form

\[Y_m^{(l)}(\theta,\phi) = (-1)^m\sqrt{2}\sqrt{\frac{2l+1}{4\pi}\frac{(l-|m|)!}{(l+|m|)!}}P_{l}^{|m|}(\cos\theta)B_m(\phi)\]

where where \(\theta\) and \(\phi\) are the polar and azimuth angles respectively, \(P_l^{|m|}(z)\) are the associated Legendre functions and

\[\begin{split}B_{m}(\phi)=\begin{cases} \sin(|m|\phi), & m < 0,\\ \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}, & m = 0,\\ \cos(|m|\phi), & m > 0. \end{cases}\end{split}\]

The returned harmonics are ordered as \(m = -l, -l+1, ..., l-1, l\) for each degree \(l\).

Here we listed the examples of first several spherical harmonics, for \(\mathbf{r}=(x,y,z)\) lying on the unit sphere \(S^2\):

\[\begin{split}\begin{aligned} \mathbf{Y}^{(0)}(\mathbf{r})&=\bigg[\sqrt{\frac{1}{4\pi}}\bigg]\\ \mathbf{Y}^{(1)}(\mathbf{r})&=\begin{bmatrix}\sqrt{\frac{3}{4\pi}}y\\\sqrt{\frac{3}{4\pi}}z\\\sqrt{\frac{3}{4\pi}}x\end{bmatrix}\\ \mathbf{Y}^{(2)}(\mathbf{r})&=\begin{bmatrix}\sqrt{\frac{15}{4\pi}}xy\\ \sqrt{\frac{15}{4\pi}}yz\\ \sqrt{\frac{5}{16\pi}}(2z^2-x^2-y^2)\\ -\sqrt{\frac{15}{4\pi}}xz\\ \sqrt{\frac{15}{16\pi}}(x^2-y^2)\end{bmatrix} \end{aligned}\end{split}\]

If there is a channel dimension in X, it will also be included in the returned spherical harmonics.

Parameters:

  • X (Tensor) – The coordinate tensor.

  • L (DegreeRange) – The degree range of spherical harmonics that we need. The maximum degree in L should not execeed 17.

  • need_normalize (bool, optional) – Whether the input needs to be normalized. Default is False.

  • dim (int, optional) – The ‘xyz’ dimension in X. Default is -1.

Returns:

Tensor of spherical harmonics.

Return type:

Tensor

Notes

The shape of the output tensor depends on the input shape and the degree range L.

equitorch.math.isht(X: torch.Tensor, L: equitorch.typing.DegreeRange, num_thetas: int, num_phis: int)

Inverse spherical harmonics transform.

\[\begin{split}F(\theta_{i},\phi_j)=\sum_{l=0}^L\sum_{m=-l}^l X_{m}^{(l)}Y_{m}^{(l)}(\theta_i,\phi_j),\\\end{split}\]

where \(\theta_i=\frac{\pi i+\frac{\pi}{2}}{\text{num_thetas}}\), \(\phi_j=\frac{2\pi j}{\text{num_phis}}\).

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape \((..., \text{num_orders}, C)\).

  • L (DegreeRange) – The degree range of spherical harmonics.

  • num_thetas (int) – The number of grid points of \(\theta\).

  • num_phis (int) – The number of grid points of \(\phi\).

Returns:

Output tensor of shape \((..., \text{num_thetas}, \text{num_phis}, C)\).

Return type:

Tensor

equitorch.math.sht(x: torch.Tensor, L: equitorch.typing.DegreeRange, num_thetas: int, num_phis: int)

The spherical harmonics transform of a function \(F(\theta, \phi)\) is defined as:

\[X_{m}^{(l)} = \int_{S^2} F(\theta, \phi) Y_{m}^{(l)}(\theta, \phi) \sin\theta \mathrm{d}\phi \mathrm{d}\theta\]

approximated by:

\[X_{m}^{(l)} \approx \sum_{i=0}^{\text{num_thetas}-1} \sum_{j=0}^{\text{num_phis}-1} F(\theta_i, \phi_j) Y_{m}^{(l)}(\theta_i, \phi_j) \sin\theta_i \Delta\theta \Delta\phi\]

where \(\theta_i=\frac{\pi i+\frac{\pi}{2}}{\text{num_thetas}}\), \(\phi_j=\frac{2\pi j}{\text{num_phis}}\), \(\Delta\theta=\frac{\pi}{\text{num_thetas}}\), \(\Delta\phi=\frac{2\pi}{\text{num_phis}}\).

Parameters:

  • x (Tensor) – Input tensor of shape \((..., \text{num_thetas}, \text{num_phis}, C)\).

  • L (DegreeRange) – The degree range of spherical harmonics.

  • num_thetas (int) – The number of grid points of \(\theta\).

  • num_phis (int) – The number of grid points of \(\phi\).

Returns:

Output tensor of shape \((..., \text{num_orders}, C)\).

Return type:

Tensor
